body_html:
Here is the code for the discriminator:

def Discriminator(inputs):
    output = tf.reshape(inputs, [-1, 3, 32, 32])

    output = lib.ops.conv2d.Conv2D('Discriminator.1', 3, DIM, 5, output, stride=2)
    output = LeakyReLU(output)

    output = lib.ops.conv2d.Conv2D('Discriminator.2', DIM, 2*DIM, 5, output, stride=2)
    output = LeakyReLU(output)

    output = lib.ops.conv2d.Conv2D('Discriminator.3', 2*DIM, 4*DIM, 5, output, stride=2)
    output = LeakyReLU(output)

    output = tf.reshape(output, [-1, 4*4*4*DIM])
    output = lib.ops.linear.Linear('Discriminator.Output', 4*4*4*DIM, 1, output)

    return tf.reshape(output, [-1])

I don't think the second derivative will be perfectly linear in all places, and I would be very surprised if that is the case because the first order derivates are not all exactly one and have variances greater than >.1

I don't think the second derivative will be perfectly linear in all places, and I would be very surprised if that is the case because the first order derivates are not all exactly one and have variances greater than >.1
body:
Here is the code for the discriminator:

```
def Discriminator(inputs):
    output = tf.reshape(inputs, [-1, 3, 32, 32])

    output = lib.ops.conv2d.Conv2D('Discriminator.1', 3, DIM, 5, output, stride=2)
    output = LeakyReLU(output)

    output = lib.ops.conv2d.Conv2D('Discriminator.2', DIM, 2*DIM, 5, output, stride=2)
    output = LeakyReLU(output)

    output = lib.ops.conv2d.Conv2D('Discriminator.3', 2*DIM, 4*DIM, 5, output, stride=2)
    output = LeakyReLU(output)

    output = tf.reshape(output, [-1, 4*4*4*DIM])
    output = lib.ops.linear.Linear('Discriminator.Output', 4*4*4*DIM, 1, output)

    return tf.reshape(output, [-1])
```
I don't think the second derivative will be perfectly linear in all places, and I would be very surprised if that is the case because the first order derivates are not all exactly one and have variances greater than >.1
